intro: Anisopetala rigida, commonly known as the rigid anisopetala, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Anisopetala rigida is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
